message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user wants me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Korea. I need to provide responses for each of the 10 statements with one of these options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about each statement from the perspective of a Korean teacher who would have practical experience with AI tools in education:

TT4G35A - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: This is reasonable - AI tools can assist with generating ideas, structure, etc. I'd say "Agree" as this is a practical benefit.

TT4G35B - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: This is true - AI can personalize content. "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Agree" as it's a known capability.

TT4G35C - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: Yes, this is what personalized learning systems do. "Agree".

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is true - AI can help with accessibility, translation, etc. "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Agree".

TT4G35E - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: Yes, this is well-established. "Strongly agree" or "Agree". I'll say "Strongly agree".

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: This is a concern - students can use AI to plagiarize. "Agree" or "Strongly agree" on this risk. I'll say "Agree" as it's a real concern but there are also preventive measures.

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: This is true - AI can make errors. "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Agree".

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: This is a legitimate concern. "Agree" - yes, this can happen if training data is biased.


Data privacy and security are significant risks with AI systems in schools, so I'd say "Agree" on that concern. Similarly, AI might suggest teaching methods that don't fit our local context or educational philosophy, which is also worth noting as "Agree". I want to reflect both the genuine advantages AI offers for personalization and efficiency, while acknowledging the real risks around plagiarism, bias, and data protection that educators face.
